Q000.rationale: Consistent use of double quotes improves code readability and follows Python community conventions. It also makes it easier to include apostrophes in strings without escaping.
Q000.csmPrinciples: This rule supports CSM's emphasis on consistency and readability. Consistent quote usage reduces cognitive load when reading code and makes the codebase more maintainable.

E501.rationale: Shorter lines improve readability, especially on smaller screens. They also make it easier to compare code side-by-side.

E302.rationale: Two blank lines provide clear visual separation between top-level elements, making the code structure more apparent and easier to navigate.
E302.csmPrinciples: This rule supports CSM's structure principle by creating clear visual boundaries that help readers understand the code's organization.

E303.rationale: Excessive blank lines can make code harder to read and navigate. Consistent spacing helps maintain visual clarity.
E303.csmPrinciples: This rule supports CSM's consistency principle by maintaining appropriate visual spacing throughout the code.

CSM1.rationale: Two blank lines before top-level functions and classes provide clear visual separation and improve code readability.

CSM2.rationale: Two blank lines after top-level functions and classes provide clear visual separation and improve code readability.

CSM3.rationale: One blank line between methods provides clear visual separation while maintaining the visual grouping of class members.
CSM3.csmPrinciples: This rule supports CSM's structure principle by creating appropriate visual hierarchy within class definitions.

CSM4.rationale: Proper placement of dunder assignments (like __version__, __author__) follows Python conventions and improves code organization.
CSM4.csmPrinciples: This rule supports CSM's structure principle by ensuring consistent and logical organization of module elements.

C0103.rationale: Consistent naming conventions help other developers understand the purpose and scope of variables, functions, and classes at a glance, thus reducing cognitive overload.

D100.rationale: Developers should document the purposes of their work to give context into usage and the project as a whole.

D103.rationale: Developers should document the purposes of their work to give context into usage and the project as a whole.

unused import.rationale: Unused imports clutter the code and may confuse readers. Removing them improves code clarity and reduces unnecessary dependencies.

unused variable.rationale: Unused variables can indicate incomplete code or logic errors. Removing them makes the codebase cleaner and easier to understand.

E225.rationale: Whitespace around operators makes them stand out in expressions and therefore leads to quick comprehension.

ERA001.rationale: Unused code should be removed to reduce mental effort.
